metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9566 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
base/logging.c in Nagios Core before 4.2.4 allows local users with access to an account in the nagios group to gain root privileges via a symlink attack on the log file.  NOTE: this can be leveraged by remote attackers using CVE-2016-9565.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nagios3 - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-cgi - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-common - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-core - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nagios3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1').
